Marilyn Stasio, Variety : " Hadestown " triggered a lot of buzz when this wholly American show (which came to the stage by way of a concept album) premiered at Off Broadway 's New York Theatre Workshop in 2016. Arriving on Broadway with its earthly delights more or less intact, this perfectly heavenly musical - with book, music and lyrics by Anaïs Mitchell - should stick around for a while. David Rooney, The Hollywood Reporter : In "Road to Hell," the exhilarating opening number of the utterly fabulous Hadestown, Hermes, the conductor of souls into the afterlife, invites us to "Ride that train to the end of the line."
